'''Octillery''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''オクタン''' ''Okutank'') is a {{type|Water}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation II]].

It [[Evolution|evolve]]s from {{p|Remoraid}} starting at [[level]] 25.

==Biology==
Octillery is a red, cephalopod-like Pokémon with large, round eyes and a turret-like mouth. There are yellow bumps on its rock-hard head and yellow suction cups on each of its eight tentacles. These suction cups and yellow bumps are smaller on a female Octillery. It uses its tentacles for manipulating objects and the suction cups give it strong gripping power. Because of this, it is very hard for it to be blown away. Octillery is the [[Signature move|only known Pokémon]] that learns {{m|Octazooka}} naturally.

Octillery is a relaxed Pokémon who loves fuss from its Trainer. In the wild, it will spurt ink containing substances that dull predators' sense of smell to protect its young from danger. Even though it is more docile when domesticated, it can be very stubborn at times in the wild. It instinctively sneaks into rocky holes, and if it gets sleepy, it steals the nest of a fellow Octillery. It sometimes sprays ink on prey by sticking out only its mouth, and its suction cups hold prey tightly. Octillery is normally found in {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Sea Pokémon|oceans}}.

==In the anime==
[[File:Officer Jenny Octillery.png|thumb|250px|left|Octillery in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
In ''[[EP215|Octillery The Outcast]]'', [[Marcellus]] in the [[Whirl Islands]] tried to get one of his Remoraid to evolve into an Octillery and succeeded.

[[Harley]] owns an Octillery, which debuted in ''[[AG160|Harley Rides Again]]''. It managed to defeat [[May's Munchlax]] in a {{pkmn|Contest}} {{pkmn|battle}}. It was later used during the second Appeal round of the [[Kanto Grand Festival]] in ''[[AG181|Thinning the Hoard!]]''.

An Octillery appeared in ''[[BW129|The Pirates of Decolore!]]'', where it was a powerful member of {{p|Croconaw}}'s pirate gang, and would often battle any Pokémon it came across. Like the other Pokémon in the gang, Octillery was abandoned by its Trainer. However, it eventually joined [[Officer Jenny]]'s new squad.

===Minor appearances===
An Octillery appeared in {{Gary}}'s explanation in ''[[EP272|Johto Photo Finish]]''.

In ''[[AG021|Which Wurmple's Which?]]'', {{Ash}} and {{ashfr}} were fishing and found an Octillery, which landed on [[Max]]'s head.

An Octillery appeared in ''[[DP149|Sticking With Who You Know!]]''.

An Octillery appeared in ''[[XY024|An Undersea Place to Call Home!]]''.

==In the manga==
[[File:Saturn Octillery Adventures.png|thumb|150px|Octillery in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
Octillery first appeared in ''[[PS101|Teddiursa's Picnic]]'' in a [[Poké Ball]] that was stuck inside the mouth of a wild {{p|Granbull}}.

An Octillery appeared in ''[[PS128|Indubitably Ditto]]'' under [[Team Rocket Elite Trio|Ken's]] control. In ''[[PS127|Miltank Melee]]'', it is used in an attempt to capture {{DL|Legendary beasts (Adventures)|Suicune}}. It was put to sleep temporarily by {{DL|Crystal (Adventures)|Parasee}}'s Spore in ''[[PS128|Indubitably Ditto]]'', but later woke up.

An Octillery was one of the Pokémon sent to help the fight in [[Ilex Forest]] in ''[[PS179|The Last Battle XIII]]''.

In ''[[PS387|Outwitting Octillery]]'', [[Saturn]] of [[Team Galactic]] used an Octillery to fend off {{adv|Pearl}} during a mission at [[Lake Verity]].

In ''[[PS446|Weavile Wobbles But It Won't Fall Down]]'', a Trainer at the {{safari|Johto}} is seen with one.

==Game data==
===NPC appearances===
* [[Pokémon Mystery Dungeon: Red Rescue Team and Blue Rescue Team]]: Octillery is the leader of Team Constrictor, a [[Rank (Mystery Dungeon)|Silver Rank]] rescue team. It joins a new team with {{p|Blastoise}} and {{p|Golem}} designed to travel through [[Magma Cavern]], but is defeated.
* {{g|Mystery Dungeon: Explorers of Sky}}: Octillery is a regular visitor of [[Spinda's Cafe]].

==Trivia==
===Origin===
Octillery is based on an {{wp|octopus}}. It also has some basis on a tank or a wheeled cannon.

====Name origin====
Octillery is a combination of ''{{wp|octopus}}'' and ''{{wp|artillery}}''.

Okutank is a combination of ''octopus'' and ''{{wp|tank}}''.
